alert.note: Alert for Boone; Calhoun; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Logan; Mingo; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Putnam; Roane; Wirt; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 5:19AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong line of thunderstorms will impact portions of central Calhoun, Kanawha, east central Putnam, east central Lincoln, southern Wirt, Roane, Wyoming, southeastern Jackson, southeastern Mingo, northwestern Raleigh, eastern Logan, west central Clay, northwestern Fayette and Boone Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 517 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong line of thunderstorm near Leroy to Sissonville to just south of Coal Mountain, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Madison, Spencer, Elizabeth, Pineville, Grantsville, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Oceana, Belle, Clendenin, Cedar Grove and East Bank. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 31. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 127. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 47 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 64 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 52 and 53, between mile markers 55 and 56, and between mile markers 62 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
